Summary Patent attorney with extensive experience with drafting and prosecuting patent applications for computer hardware, computer software and electrical inventions. Specialties:DMA controllers, interrupt controllers, memory controllers, I/O interfaces (e.g. PCI, USB, LPC, SCSI), networking protocols, platform virtualization (e.g. Intel LaGrande Technology(LT) & Virtualization Technology (VT), software tools (e.g. compilers, Java virtual machines), cryptography/digital rights management (e.g. LT, SHA, RSA, DES), audio/video encoding (e.g. MPEG, MP3), multi-processor hardware support, power management support (e.g. ACPI), operating systems and device drivers. Experience Assistant Director of Patents Intel Corporation September 2014  – Present (1 year) Irvine, CA Patent Group Counsel, Patent Portfolio Strategist, Senior Patent Attorney INTEL CORPORATION July 2002  –  September 2014  (12 years 3 months) Irvine, California Managed Intel Global Prosecution Strategy team to identify best practices to strategically manage Intel's global patent portfolio. Developed ongoing portfolio strategies and portfolio management practices for Intel’s software and graphics technologies. Provided patent training and other patent advice to business units and manage outside US and foreign counsel on various activities including patent prosecution and offensive and defensive patent reviews. Managed a group of 8 senior patent attorneys.  
 
Previously, drafted and prosecuted numerous patent applications covering the range of Intel’s software technologies as well as performed day to day portfolio management of Intel’s Software patent portfolio, including communicating with inventors as well as outside counsel. Associate RIORDAN & MCKINZIE (now Bingham McCutchen) March 2000  –  June 2002  (2 years 4 months) Los Angeles, CA Intellectual property practice, with a focus on intellectual property transactional matters. Negotiated and drafted a broad range of intellectual property agreements. Counseled clients on various intellectual property and business matters, including patent and trademark prosecution strategies, general licensing strategies, litigation strategies, and copyright and trade secret matters. Participated as intellectual property specialist on various mergers and acquisitions; tasks include conducting due diligence and counseling clients on intellectual property matters relating to the mergers and acquisitions. Drafted patent and trademark applications and communicate with the Patent and Trademark Office on a variety of prosecution related matters. Wrote non-infringement and invalidity opinion letters. Participated in a variety of intellectual property litigation matters. Volunteered as mentor for participants in the Southern California Technology Venture Forum. Associate HOWREY & SIMON April 1998  –  March 2000  (2 years) Menlo Park, CA and Los Angeles, CA Participated in various phases of patent and intellectual property litigation matters, primarily in the areas of internet software patent litigation and biotechnology patent litigation Prepared a variety of motions including motions to transfer, motions to stay, motions to dismiss, motions for temporary restraining orders, motions to compel discovery, motions for preliminary injunction and summary judgement motions. Drafted complaints and answers. Participated in various aspects of discovery, including drafting discovery requests, responding to discovery requests, document production, deposition preparation and interacting with opposing counsel to resolve numerous of discovery disputes. Communicated with clients to update them on litigation strategy and progress. Law Clerk then Associate BLAKELY, SOKOLOFF, TAYLOR & ZAFMAN May 1995  –  March 1998  (2 years 11 months) Sunnyvale, CA Drafted patent applications and communicate with the Patent and Trademark Office on a variety of prosecution related matters. Filed numerous software patent applications focused on Internet related technologies such as Java-based web applications, web protocols, push technology and web application development tools. Also filed software patent applications in the areas of networking, compilers, graphics, databases and object-oriented programming. Filed hardware applications related to microprocessor architecture. Acted as responsible attorney for three startup corporation clients. Provided client counseling on a variety of intellectual property issues, with an emphasis on patent prosecution strategies. Client counseling also included a variety of defensive patent portfolio reviews for the purpose of making licensing recommendations. Wrote opinion letters in response to client requests. Wrote opinions in the areas of networking and database application technology. Served on Summer Associate Recruiting Committee. Summary Global intellectual property (IP) portfolio and budget management; development of corporate IP culture, strategies, policies, guidelines, procedures, and budget; risk assessment and counseling on IP-related commercial transactions; pre-litigation resolution of IP disputes; patent preparation, prosecution, and counseling (patentability, freedom-to-operate, infringement, and validity); global brand protection and enforcement; trademark clearance, prosecution, counseling, and licensing; patent litigation and trademark opposition support; negotiation and preparation of coexistence, consent-to-use and/or register agreements; investigation and enforcement of IP rights related to social media, domain name, and Internet activities (new gTLDs); copyright prosecution and counseling; trade secret counseling and invention disclosure harvesting; technology transactions; corporate training and education related to IP; and training and mentoring attorneys, law clerks, and interns with respect to IP practice.
